teaching_philosophy.title: Teaching Philosophy
paragraphs: I believe in hands-on learning that combines rigorous theoretical foundations with practical applications. My teaching emphasizes critical thinking, formal reasoning, and the development of computational skills that prepare students for both academic research and industry careers.

I strive to make abstract concepts concrete through examples, interactive demonstrations, and real-world applications. Students learn best when they can connect formal theories to practical problems and see the relevance of logic and AI in modern technology.

My approach encourages active participation, collaborative problem-solving, and independent exploration. I aim to foster curiosity and equip students with tools for lifelong learning in rapidly evolving fields.

current_courses.title: Logic and Philosophy of Science
current_courses.description: Foundational course covering propositional and predicate logic, philosophy of science, scientific method, and the relationship between formal logic and scientific reasoning. Topics include logical consequence, proof systems, scientific explanation, and epistemological foundations.

current_courses.title: Epistemology of Big Data
current_courses.description: Graduate seminar exploring epistemological questions raised by big data analytics, machine learning, and data-driven science. Examines issues of induction, explanation, causality, bias, and the nature of knowledge in data science.

current_courses.title: Computational Epistemology
current_courses.description: Advanced course on formal models of knowledge, belief revision, epistemic logic, and computational approaches to epistemological problems. Covers modal logics, dynamic epistemic logic, and applications to AI and multi-agent systems.

current_courses.title: Logic in Physiotherapy Practice
current_courses.department: Department of Neurosciences, Biomedicine and Movement Sciences
current_courses.description: Introduction to logical reasoning and critical thinking for healthcare professionals. Covers reasoning in clinical practice, evaluation of evidence, diagnostic reasoning, and avoiding common logical fallacies in medical decision-making.

current_courses.title: Computer Science Laboratory
current_courses.description: Hands-on programming course covering Python fundamentals, data structures, algorithms, and introduction to AI/ML libraries. Students develop practical coding skills and learn to implement algorithms for data processing and analysis.

current_courses.title: AI and Neuroscience Laboratory
current_courses.description: Interdisciplinary lab exploring connections between artificial intelligence and neuroscience. Covers neural networks, computational models of cognition, brain-inspired computing, and applications of AI to neuroscience research.

past_courses.title: Machine Reasoning
past_courses.description: Graduate course on automated reasoning, logic programming, constraint satisfaction, and knowledge representation. Assisted with tutorials, lab sessions, and student project supervision.

past_courses.title: Foundations of Machine Learning
past_courses.description: Core ML course covering supervised and unsupervised learning, statistical learning theory, and practical implementation. Led tutorial sessions on probabilistic models and optimization algorithms.

past_courses.title: Programming Principles
past_courses.description: Introductory programming course in Java covering object-oriented programming, data structures, and software design principles. Conducted lab sessions and provided one-on-one student support.

past_courses.title: Logic and Computation
past_courses.description: Undergraduate logic course covering propositional and predicate logic, proof theory, and computational aspects of logic. Assisted with problem sets and exam preparation.

past_courses.title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
past_courses.description: Foundational AI course covering search algorithms, knowledge representation, planning, and reasoning under uncertainty. Led tutorial sessions on probabilistic reasoning and logic-based AI.

past_courses.title: Theoretical Computer Science
past_courses.department: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science
past_courses.description: Undergraduate course on formal languages, automata theory, computability, and complexity theory. Assisted with exercises on Turing machines and complexity classes.

guest_lectures.title: Introduction to Machine Learning for Linguists
guest_lectures.institution: University of Verona / Free University of Bolzano
guest_lectures.description: Introductory lecture on machine learning concepts tailored for linguistics students, covering supervised learning, feature engineering, and applications to NLP.

guest_lectures.title: Bayesian Methods in Statistics and Machine Learning
guest_lectures.description: Seminar on Bayesian inference, prior selection, posterior computation, and applications to machine learning and data analysis.

guest_lectures.title: Probabilistic Reasoning and Bayesian Networks
guest_lectures.description: Tutorial on probabilistic graphical models, Bayesian networks, inference algorithms, and learning from data.

guest_lectures.title: Logic Programming and Answer Set Programming
guest_lectures.description: Guest lecture on logic programming paradigms, Answer Set Programming, and applications to knowledge representation and reasoning.

guest_lectures.title: Machine Learning meets Logic: Inductive Logic Programming
guest_lectures.description: Workshop talk on the intersection of machine learning and logic, focusing on inductive logic programming and learning from structured data.

guest_lectures.title: Epistemic Logic and Knowledge Representation
guest_lectures.description: Seminar on modal epistemic logic, knowledge representation in multi-agent systems, and dynamic epistemic logic.
